channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal agents arrest 2 more in connection to Minnesota church storming
item.description: The Justice Department last week arrested Don Lemon and others in connection with their alleged involvement in the same protest.

item.title: In A Big Win For Free Speech, Judge Blocks Hawaii Law Censoring Political Satire
item.description: The Democrat-led law targeted the Babylon Bee and other satirical sites, claiming their content risks 'changing ... voter behavior.'

item.title: Trump erupts about Trevor Noah joke linking him to Bill Clinton and Jeffrey Epstein: ‘I can’t speak for Bill, but I have never been to Epstein Island’
item.description: Trevor Noah's savage joke said Trump wants Greenland because "Epstein’s island is gone, he needs a new island to hang out with Bill Clinton."

item.title: ‘No one is illegal on stolen land’: how the Grammys turned into a giant Trump roast and ICE protest
item.description: Even Justin and Hailey Bieber, who don’t normally address American politics, wore protest pins about ICE.

item.title: The ‘Mostly Peaceful’ Riots Are Back
item.description: Portland wasn’t alone, as local protesters clashed with local police over the weekend.

item.title: It’s so cold in Florida that iguanas are falling out of trees
item.description: “I think in South Florida you're going to see iguanas falling from trees, I mean a lot, once it gets under 40 degrees,” Gov. Ron DeSantis said.

item.title: Longtime Iowa federal judge dies at 78 after more than 26 years on the bench
item.description: Robert Pratt, who served as an Iowa federal judge for more than 26 years, died Wednesday at 78 after suffering cardiac arrest while at a gym.

item.title: Philly DA’s ‘hunt you down’ warning to ICE draws calls for DOJ criminal probe

item.title: It’s Illegal For Leftist Agitators To Encourage High School Walkouts. Time To Prosecute

item.title: Here’s How To Cook Good Food On $15 A Day Or Less
item.description: The $15-a-day debate is about whether we still value self-reliance, basic household skills, and personal responsibility.

item.title: Infighting, money woes drag down NRA's comeback as a heavyweight in American politics
item.description: Dismal fundraising and internal strife have hobbled the 154-year-old National Rifle Association in the quest to regain its status as a political power...

item.title: New list identifies immigration sanctuary school districts across the U.S.
item.description: Defending Education has compiled a list of more than 700 school districts from around the country that have passed resolutions or published guidance o...

item.title: ‘The Chinese have invaded us in terms of merchandise’: Mexico and Argentina lead Latin America’s struggles with flood of imports

item.title: Europe-wide army is a dumb idea, EU foreign policy chief says: ‘maybe those people haven’t really thought this through practically’
item.description: “If you are already part of NATO then you can’t create a separate army," Kaja Kallas said at a security conference in Norway.

item.title: Trump to confront Colombia's Petro on drug allegations as U.S. overdose deaths decline
item.description: Drug overdose deaths in the U.S. have dropped by 21% through most of last year as the Trump administration escalates its efforts to crack down on both...

item.title: Senate GOP Can Fix Elections, Boost Trump, And Wreck Dems With The SAVE Act
item.description: A voter ID filibuster would be a 24/7 GOP campaign ad.

item.title: Sanctioned Russian jet touches down in Cuba, echoing secret flights before Maduro's ouster
item.description: Russian cargo plane reportedly lands at Cuban military base amid escalating U.S.-Cuba tensions and Trump's national emergency declaration over Havana.

item.title: Americans Vote with Their Feet for Red States

item.title: Trump threatens to sue comedian Trevor Noah over Epstein joke at Grammys
item.description: President Trump on Monday threatened to sue Trevor Noah over a joke the comedian made during the Grammys linking Mr. Trump to deceased sex offender Je...

item.title: Illegal immigrant in Florida charged with arson, felony criminal mischief, sheriff says
item.description: Florida police charged ab illegal immigrant with arson after he allegedly set fires under a mobile home and broke windows at a local business.

item.title: Don Lemon Apologists Are Gaslighting America About The Grand Jury Indictment
item.description: Efforts to denigrate the grand jury’s indictment of Lemon are greatly flawed.

item.title: Virginia Proposal to Expand Offshore Wind Power Threatens National Security
item.description: Wind projects create radar interference and clutter that could put U.S. assets in Norfolk at risk.

item.title: Our Radical Moment’s Antecedents
item.description: So much of the tumult around us has its roots in the 1970s, the subject of Jason Burke’s new study.

item.title: NPR and PBS Never Needed Your Taxpayer Dollars
item.description: ‘Vanishingly few’ stations have shuttered so far. Surprised?
